Hypothesis: `` The Law of Cycles '' is an abstract concept related to magical girls in Puella Magi Madoka Magica .
Premise: `` This rewrites the laws of the universe , resulting in Madoka transcending into an abstract concept called `` '' The Law of Cycles '' '' which ferries magical girls away at the moment of their despair and Homura being the only one who remembers her in the new world that is formed. ''
Relationship: entailment
Explanation: the law of cycles is an abstract concept that is related to magical girls in Puella Magi Madoka Magica.

Hypothesis: A baby tiger is playing with a ball
Premise: A tiger cub is playing with a ball
Relationship: entailment
Explanation: a tiger cub is a baby tiger.

Hypothesis: A person is standing in the snow at the edge of a mountain
Premise: A man is standing at dusk on an almost pristine, snowy road, that is lit only by headlights
Relationship: neutral
Explanation: the fact that a man is standing at dusk does not imply that he is standing in the snow.

Hypothesis: a former councillor has appeared in court charged with possessing indecent images of children.
Premise: Hull city councillor Steven Bayes also pleaded not guilty to possessing an extreme pornographic image when he appeared at the city's crown court. The 55-year-old was suspended from the Labour Party in October after it "became aware of a police investigation into him", a party spokesman said. He was released on unconditional bail and is due to stand trial on 5 February 2018 at the same court. Mr Bayes was first elected as a councillor in 1985. He was involved in Hull's bid to secure the UK City of Culture title and is a former vice chair of the Hull 2017 company, which is organising arts activities and events for the year-long celebration.
Relationship: contradiction
Explanation: the fact that Steven Bayes has pleaded not guilty to possessing an extreme pornographic image does not mean he is a child abuser.

Hypothesis: A snowboarder is grinding down a long rail
Premise: A person is doing a trick on a snowboard
Relationship: neutral
Explanation: a person doing a trick on a snowboard is not necessarily grinding down a long rail.
This is a attention test, please select Weakly Yes, None

Hypothesis: images courtesy of afp, epa, getty images and climbers and other sea creatures in the ocean have been caught on camera.
Premise: Parts of the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean are up to 11 kilometres deep, so we know little about what sea life there is. So a team has been sending down a robotic submarine called Deep Discoverer with a camera on it. Science fans or anyone who is just curious can check out what the camera is showing online. The three-month expedition is looking for things like fish, mud volcanoes and deep sea coral. So far they've spotted shrimp, jellyfish and black pillow lava from an underwater eruption.
Relationship: contradiction
Explanation: there is no evidence that any of the creatures on the submarine are climbers.
